, the Labour leader, said Mr Andy Coulson 's departure was long overdue and questioned Mr David Cameron 's judgment for keeping him on the public payroll for so long. In a statement, Mr Andy Coulson said: Nothing is more important than the Government's task of getting this country back on its feet. Unfortunately, continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 per cent needed in this role. "I stand by what I've said about those events but, when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on. Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening. Early estimates put voting turnout at 94.4 percent. The results of the ballot were expected around 2300 GMT. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday.
